resources.string:
âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Requires high rainfall (120-250 cm) and humid conditions

 âœ… Soil: Best grown in alluvial and clayey soil

 âœ… Usage: Staple food in Odisha, used for rice-based dishes like Pakhala Bhata

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Grown in coastal and delta regions like Cuttack and Puri

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Field puddling, apply 10-15 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July & Nov-Dec): Transplanting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 30-40 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Jan): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before transplanting

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Continuous flooding; Butachlor (1.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Blast, Bacterial leaf blight â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct & March-April): 120-150 days. Yield: 3-5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Requires 50-100 cm rainfall with warm temperatures

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained sandy loam soil

 âœ… Usage: Used in food, fodder, and industrial products

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in western Odisha (Koraput, Kalahandi)

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June & Oct-Nov): Apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July & Oct-Nov): Drilling method (60 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 20-25 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 120 kg N, 60 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): 2-3 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fall armyworm, rust â€“ Neem oil or Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct & Feb-March): 90-120 days. Yield: 3-4 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 âœ… Climate: Grows well in areas with 100-120 cm rainfall

 âœ… Soil: Prefers red and lateritic soil

 âœ… Usage: Used for porridge, roti, and baby food

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Common in tribal areas like Kandhamal and Rayagada

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Plowing, apply 8-10 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 8-10 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Aug): 40 kg N, 30 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Sept): 2 irrigations; Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Blast, smut â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 110-130 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Requires 50-75 cm rainfall and warm weather

 âœ… Soil: Best in sandy loam soil with good drainage

 âœ… Usage: Used for dal, sprouts, and sweets

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Widely grown in coastal districts like Balasore and Bhadrak

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (July & Nov): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Yellow mosaic virus â€“ Neem oil spray or Imidacloprid (0.5 ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept & Feb-March): 80-100 days. Yield: 1-1.5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Requires 60-80 cm rainfall and moderate temperatures

 âœ… Soil: Grows in loamy or lateritic soil

 âœ… Usage: Used in dal, snacks, and idli batter

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in interior districts like Nuapada and Malkangiri

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (July & Nov): Broadcasting method (30 cm spacing). Seed rate: 15-20 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 30 kg N, 40 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Mostly rain-fed, one irrigation at pod formation. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Powdery mildew â€“ Sulfur spray (2g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept & Feb-March): 90-110 days. Yield: 1-2 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon)

 âœ… Climate: Needs warm, humid climate with 50-75 cm rainfall

 âœ… Soil: Thrives in sandy loam soil with good drainage

 âœ… Usage: Used in oil extraction, sweets, and Ayurvedic medicine

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in districts like Ganjam and Kendrapara

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July): Apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (July-Aug): Broadcasting method (20 cm spacing). Seed rate: 3-5 kg/ha

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 20 kg N, 30 kg P, 20 kg K/ha before sowing

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Oct): Rain-fed crop, one irrigation at flowering. Pendimethalin (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Leaf spot â€“ Copper oxychloride (2g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 80-100 days. Yield: 0.8-1.5 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Summer (April-July)

 âœ… Climate: Requires tropical & subtropical climate, rainfall 75-250 cm

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained loamy soil

 âœ… Usage: Fresh consumption, juices, pickles

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Grown in Ganjam, Dhenkanal, Angul

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-August): 8x8m spacing, grafted saplings used

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K per tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, mulching with dry leaves

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Mango hoppers â€“ Neem-based insecticide spray

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (April-July): 3-5 years after planting, yield 12-15 tons/ha
ğŸŒ³ Guava \n (Allahabad Safeda, Arka Kiran, L-49)

âœ… Season: Winter & Summer

 âœ… Climate: Requires tropical climate, rainfall 100-150 cm

 âœ… Soil: Best in sandy loam or lateritic soil

 âœ… Usage: Consumed fresh, in jams, juices

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Cuttack, Bhadrak, Mayurbhanj

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (April-May): 10-12 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June-July): 5x5m spacing, deep pits for seedlings

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 400g N, 250g P, 500g K per tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit fly â€“ Malathion spray (2ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-April): 2-3 years after planting, yield 15-20 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Year-round

 âœ… Climate: Hot & humid climate, rainfall 150-200 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, rich in organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, banana chips, fiber production

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Balasore, Koraput, Puri

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Jan-Feb): 20-25 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (March-April): 1.5x1.5m spacing, suckers transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Dec): 300g N, 200g P, 400g K per tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with banana leaves

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Panama wilt â€“ Copper fungicide spray (3g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (10-12 months after planting): Yield 30-35 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Summer (March-June)

 âœ… Climate: Tropical & humid, rainfall 150-200 cm

 âœ… Soil: Lateritic, well-drained soil

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, processed into chips, sweets

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Found in Rayagada, Kandhamal, Keonjhar

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (March-April): 15-20 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (May-June): 8x8m spacing, saplings transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (June-Nov): 500g N, 300g P, 400g K per tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with organic matter

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit borer â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (March-June): 4-5 years after planting, yield 20-25 tons/ha
Coconut (East Coast Tall, Odisha Tall, Chandrakalpa)
ğŸ¥¥ Coconut \n (East Coast Tall, Odisha Tall, Chandrakalpa)

âœ… Season: Year-round

 âœ… Climate: Tropical & humid, rainfall 150-300 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy soil with good moisture retention

 âœ… Usage: Oil extraction, fresh consumption, coir industry

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Khurda, Puri, Ganjam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (April-May): 10-12 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June-July): 7.5x7.5m spacing, seedlings planted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 500g N, 250g P, 500g K per tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (July-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching with coconut husk

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Rhinoceros beetle â€“ Neem cake application

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Year-round): 5-6 years after planting, yield 80-100 nuts/tree

âœ… Season: Rainy & Winter (July-December)

 âœ… Climate: Humid subtropical, rainfall 150-250 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam with acidic pH

 âœ… Usage: Fresh fruit, juices, processed products

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Grown in Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar, Sundargarh

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (March-April): 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (May-June): 30x60 cm spacing, suckers planted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (June-Dec): 200g N, 150g P, 250g K/tree

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, weeding every 45 days

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Mealybugs â€“ Insecticide spray (Chlorpyrifos 2ml/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (July-Dec): 2 years after planting, yield 30-35 tons/ha
Brinjal (Utkal Anushree, Utkal Keshari, Swarna Mani)
ğŸ† Brinjal \n (Utkal Anushree, Utkal Keshari, Swarna Mani)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-30Â°C), moderate rainfall 80-120 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used for curries, fries, and pickles

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Grown in Cuttack, Balasore, Ganjam

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June & Oct): Plowed 2-3 times, FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Nursery Raising (June-July, Oct-Nov): Seeds sown in raised beds, transplanted after 25-30 days

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 50 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Light irrigation at 7-10 days interval

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Shoot borer â€“ Neem oil spray, Carbaryl dust for aphids

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Feb): 70-80 days after transplanting, yield 25-30 tons/ha
Tomato (Arka Rakshak, Utkal Kumari, Swarna Lalima)
ğŸ… Tomato \n (Arka Rakshak, Utkal Kumari, Swarna Lalima)

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Moderate temperature (20-25Â°C), low humidity

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loam, rich in organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, sauces, and salads

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Kandhamal, Bargarh, Sambalpur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plowing with FYM 20 tons/ha

 2ï¸âƒ£ Nursery Raising (Nov-Dec): Seedlings raised in trays, transplanted at 25 days

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 120 kg N, 80 kg P, 100 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-April): Drip irrigation preferred

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Early blight â€“ Mancozeb spray (2.5g/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (March-May): 90-100 days after transplanting, yield 30-35 tons/ha
ğŸ¥¦ Cauliflower \n (Snowball-16, Pusa Meghna, Swarna Ageti)

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter)

 âœ… Climate: Cool climate (15-20Â°C), moderate rainfall 80-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, fries, and pickles

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Koraput, Rayagada, Nayagarh

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Aug-Sept): Plowing 2-3 times, FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Nursery Raising (Sept-Oct): Seeds sown in trays, transplanted at 30-35 days

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Oct-Dec): 120 kg N, 80 kg P, 100 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Nov-Feb): Irrigated every 7-10 days, earthing up done

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Downy mildew â€“ Copper oxychloride spray

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Jan-March): 90-110 days after transplanting, yield 20-25 tons/ha
ğŸŒ¶ï¸ Chilli \n (Utkal Ava, Utkal Rashmi, Byadagi-1)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Warm climate (22-30Â°C), moderate rainfall 80-120 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used as a spice and in pickles

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Balangir, Kalahandi, Malkangiri

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June, Oct-Nov): Plowing 2-3 times, FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Nursery Raising (June & Nov): Seeds sown in raised beds, transplanted at 30-35 days

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Irrigation every 7-10 days, mulching applied

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Thrips â€“ Neem oil spray, fungal issues managed with Mancozeb spray

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Feb): 120-150 days after transplanting, yield 15-20 tons/ha
Okra (Utkal Gaurav, Arka Anamika, Pusa Bhindi-5)
ğŸŒ± Okra \n (Utkal Gaurav, Arka Anamika, Pusa Bhindi-5)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Warm and humid (25-35Â°C), moderate rainfall 80-120 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, fries, and sambar

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Angul, Khordha, Keonjhar

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Feb-April, June-Aug): Plowing 2-3 times, FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (March-May, July-Sept): Direct seeding at 45x30 cm spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Aug): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (May-Sept): Irrigation every 4-5 days in summer

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Whitefly â€“ Neem oil spray, Yellow vein mosaic virus managed with resistant varieties

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (June-Nov): 45-55 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha
Onion (NHRDF Red-2, Bhima Shakti, Agrifound Light Red)
ğŸ§… Onion \n (NHRDF Red-2, Bhima Shakti, Agrifound Light Red)

âœ… Season: Rabi & Kharif

 âœ… Climate: Cool season (15-25Â°C), moderate rainfall 80-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam, pH 6.0-7.5

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and raw salads

 âœ… Odisha Relevance: Cultivated in Sambalpur, Boudh, Sundargarh

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plowed & beds prepared, FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Nursery Raising (Nov-Dec): Seedlings raised in trays, transplanted at 45 days

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Dec-April): Irrigation every 5-7 days, mulching applied

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Thrips â€“ Neem oil spray, Purple blotch controlled with Mancozeb spray

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (March-May): 90-110 days after transplanting, yield 25-30 tons/ha
4)Bhoomihina Agriculturist Loan and Resources Augmentation Model
ğŸŒ± Bhoomihina Agriculturist Loan and Resources Augmentation Model (BALARAM)
BALARAM is a scheme by the Odisha government to provide loans to landless farmers and sharecroppers for agricultural activities.
- Landless farmers, sharecroppers, or oral lessees.\n - Resident of Odisha.\n - Member of a Joint Liability Group (JLG) of 5 members.
- Loan up to â‚¹1.6 lakh per JLG.\n - No collateral required.\n - Loans for crop production, equipment, and farm activities.
Applications open year-round. Apply during any cropping season.
Visit Krishi Bhavan or contact Block Agricultural Officer (BAO). Register JLG and apply through partner banks.
Supports farmers with subsidies for buying modern farm equipment.
All farmers of Odisha, including FPOs and Cooperatives.
Subsidies for tractors, power tillers, harvesters, and tools.
Applications open before cropping seasons as notified.
Apply online on the Agriculture Department portal or visit Krishi Bhavan.
